ai-ud1.8:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud1.8:1.3_0: Now at that time around Venerable Saṅgāmaji had arrived at Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.
ai-ud1.8:1.4_0: To venerable Saṅgāmajī’s former wife heard about this.
ai-ud1.8:1.6_0: and went to the Jetavana, taking their boy.
ai-ud1.8:2.1_0: Now at that time Venerable Saṅgāmaji was sitting at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
ai-ud1.8:2.2_0: Then she went to Saṅgāmaji’s former wife,
ai-ud1.8:2.2_1: and after going, she said to venerable Saṅgāmajī:
ai-ud1.8:2.3_0: “I have a little child, ascetic, so please provide for me.”
ai-ud1.8:2.4_0: When she said this, Saṅgāmaji kept silent.
ai-ud1.8:3.1_0: For a second time she said,
ai-ud1.8:3.2_0: “I have a little child, ascetic, so please provide for me.”
ai-ud1.8:3.3_0: For a second time, Saṅgāmaji kept silent.
ai-ud1.8:4.1_0: For a third time she said,
ai-ud1.8:4.2_0: “I have a little child, ascetic, so please provide for me.”
ai-ud1.8:4.3_0: For a third time, Saṅgāmaji kept silent.
ai-ud1.8:5.1_0: Then she put down the boy in front of Saṅgāmaji, saying,
ai-ud1.8:5.2_0: “This is your son, ascetic, you must take care of him.”
ai-ud1.8:6.1_0: But Saṅgāmaji neither looked at the boy nor spoke to him.
ai-ud1.8:6.2_0: Then his former wife went a little distance away. Looking back, she saw Saṅgāmaji ignoring the boy, and thought,
ai-ud1.8:6.3_0: “This ascetic doesn’t even want his child.”
ai-ud1.8:6.4_0: Therefore, after turning back and taking the boy, she went away.
ai-ud1.8:6.5_0: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, the Buddha saw how Saṅgāmaji’s went back for the child.
ai-ud1.8:7.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud1.8:8.1_0: “When she came he was not glad,
ai-ud1.8:8.3_0: Victorious in battle, freed from chains,
ai-ud1.8:8.4_0: that’s who I call a brahmin.”
